shops.preamble: Delilahrae's Shop is located in [River's Rest, Olive Grove] at a hand-laid riverstone shop with a scalloped slate shingle roof, and is currently open for business.

raw: Analysis of a tufted bum roll indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This roll is part of the Terinan Collection of 5122.
The collection comprises multi-tier, high fashion clothing and wares, drawn from the historical archives of the Terinan family.
Wares come in two types: FORMs and ITEMs.  ITEMs are divided into CATEGORIES, which correspond roughly to areas of the body.

FORMs can be worn alone, without ITEMs.  ITEMs can be worn alone, without FORMs.  ITEMs can be attached to FORMs to add fluff messaging to the FORM.  ITEMs worn as stand-alone pieces, not on a FORM, convey no fluff messaging.
Each CATEGORY of ITEM corresponds to an area of the body that would make up part of a single overall garment.  Only one ITEM per category can be applied to a FORM at a time.
FORMs can have their 15/15/15 altered.  FORMs can have long descriptions.  FORMs have automatic LOOK descriptions that cannot be changed.

ITEMs can have their article and adjective fields altered, but not their nouns.  For items with TWO WORD nouns, the first word MUST be present as the final word in the adjective field and the second word MUST be present in the noun field.  ITEMs cannot have long descriptions.  ITEMs can have LOOK descriptions, but these are not visible when worn on a FORM.
To attach an ITEM to a FORM, hold both items in hand and WRAP roll.
A tufted bum roll is part of the WAIST-WORN series and may have the following nouns: stomacher, bum roll, peascod belly, panniers
This ITEM conveys the verb PROD when attached to a FORM.
This piece can be lightened, deepened, and altered according to the notes above.
The bum roll will cost 150,000 coins.
Analysis of a cracked and gnarled hand indicates the creator has provided the following information:

The gnarled hand is The Blood Red Hand, a thin waxy membrane that lays over its bearer's hands.  Its description may be freely altered as long as it remains a hand.  Additionally, a merchant may be able to change the hand's nail (cracked) or finger (gnarled) descriptions.
The hand is currently tier 1 of 4.
The hand currently has access to the following verbs: LEAN, SCRATCH* [AT], SLAP* [AT], TOUCH, TWITCH*, WAVE AT.
Verbs marked with an asterisk (*) will behave differently based on your DEMEANOR.
The gnarled hand will cost 3,000,000 coins.

* Adjective field (second 15) should ideally be a color
* Noun must remain a scarf
* Scarves are large, so no tiny or small descriptions
* The scarf should be fairly colorful (no blacks, browns, greys, or whites as the predominant color)
* Must be a fabric (embroidery is allowed)
* No gem dusting, beading, feathers, etc.
The teal scarf will cost 500,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 5,000 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of cloth.
It has a permanently unlocked loresong by Ahkasha.

raw: The charm can not be worn.

This cat charm is a charm bracelet charm.
This particular charm is an animated charm.
This animated charm is of the type: Tabby Cat.
You can POKE it to activate it.
This charm can be attached to a charm bracelet, though you can SPREAD it to make it wearable on its own.
WARNING: Once made wearable, it can no longer go on a bracelet.
Any willing merchant should be able to change the 15/15/15, long, and show of this charm, though the noun must remain "charm".
The cat charm will cost 1,000,000 coins.

Analysis of a bundle of blood red eagle fletchings indicates the creator has provided the following information:

You get the distinct impression that any willing merchant can alter the fletchings, but be aware that only the "adjective" part of the fletchings's base will show up on a finished arrow (meaning, only the adjective part of the 15/15/15 (the middle 15) will show up on fletched arrows).  Due to this, some merchants may only be willing to alter that part of your fletchings.

Alterations to the adjective must make sense to be on a fletching.  This includes: colors; paint and dyes (eg. blue-painted, red-dyed, green-stained); designs that make sense on a small fletching (pink-striped, trident-stamped); or feathers of a specific bird (green parrot, mottled falcon).  Nothing crazy, like attachable adornments (no deathstone-studded fletchings!), are allowed.

Analysis of a mithril-bound short narwhal tusk indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The Ale Festival Drinking Horn
Designed to store liquid and will hold a maximum of 20 sips, though some special containers are offered that are unlimited.
Verb Traps: CLOSE, DRINK, MEASURE, OPEN, REMOVE, TURN, POUR*, WEAR
* POUR - This verb works one-way, allowing you to fill the tusk.
Unlocks:
Any dwarven merchant may unlock this item and any Ale Festival Merchant may as well.
Alterations:

The noun must remain horn or tusk.  The overall design must remain dwarven in nature.  Bandings, tips, and ornaments made of common dwarven materials like invar, mithril, and glaes, are encouraged in their descriptions.  Dwarves also like gems; feel free to adorn them with all types of gemstones found across Elanthia when altering these items.  Mundane and magical creatures alike throughout Elanthia can be used for the primary material of these drinking vessels as long as they have large enough horns or tusks to drink from.  (e.g. minotaur horn, ox horn, vor'taz horn, tsark tusk, boar tusk).
Customizations:

Lid/Cap option requires a noun (ie: lid, cap, cover).  Tip/end is the referencing point of the lid and can be either material or a gemstone.  Ornament can be a design that is carved into the side of the tusk and will always start with "the" in the areas it is displayed.  Strap/chain is referenced when wearing the tusk and should include a noun.  It will always be preceded by "the."  Clasp/buckle is referenced when wearing and removing the tusk.  It is the method by which the tusk is held in place.  It is always preceeded by "its" or "the."  When altering the solemn toast, capitalize the sentence and do not use punctuation.
Customization Fields:
Lid/Cap: bleached coral lid
Tip/End: mithril-bound end
Ornament: dwarven emblem
Strap/Chain: strap
Clasp/buckle: clasp
Solemn Toast: To kin and kegs.
Cheerful Toast: (ONLY VISIBLE WITH UNLOCK) - May your barrels never run dry!
Special Dwarven Abilities:
* Ability to drink from the tusk while it is worn.

This is a Sacred Flame oil lamp.  When filled with lamp oil, it can be lit and diffuses fragrance to the room.

This item has Stay-Put qualities.  If you PLACE it, it will be moved to the ground in your current room and stay there, unable to be picked up by others or taken by the janitor, for 4 hours.  You may NUDGE it at a valid container to place the lamp on top of the container until you NUDGE it out of its place again.  After the duration expires, the item is fair game for others and for the janitor. items.name: an ahmdir blue yierka wool cape

raw: An ahmdir blue yierka wool cape has an etched bone bangle fitted into the left corner where the fabric has been stitched to form a sleeve, while the right corner has a lacquered morduska talon fibula pinned to it.
It is estimated that an ahmdir blue yierka wool cape can store a significant amount with enough space for any number of items.
Analysis of an ahmdir blue yierka wool cape indicates the creator has provided the following information:

An ahmdir blue yierka wool cape is part of the Shield Cape Collection, which was purchased at Duskruin in the shop "Shield Thyself".  It is a passive defense item that has a chance to block an incoming blow.  The chance increases with each tier that is unlocked.  If the wearer has no weapons in his hands, no shield/runestaff, or is using a bow/crossbow, then he gets the full benefit of the cape.  Otherwise the chance is halved.
Its current status is OTS and that gives it access to the following verbs: pull (removes brooch), push (adds brooch), remove, turn (removes bangle), twist (adds bangle), wear
To upgrade its abilities, you will need to obtain an unlock certificate.

Brooch Data: (Brooch is Absent) A lacquered morduska talon fibula can be changed by using PULL to remove the brooch and PUSH to add a new one.  Please note, only specialized brooches will work.  Once your brooch is upgraded from the default piece, it unlocks a 50% chance to retain a charge within it for each successful block.  When the brooch reaches 10 charges, it automatically flares and absorbs all of the charges.

Bangle Data: (Bangle is absent) An etched bone bangle can be changed by using TURN to remove the bangle and TWIST to add a new one.  Please note, only specialized bangles will work.  Once your bangle is upgraded from the default piece, it provides an additional 25% chance to absorb a charge.  It will not provide this additional percentage chance if the brooch is not upgraded.  Additionally, bangles can have special unlocks to change the flare type.

You may alter an ahmdir blue yierka wool cape freely providing it does not contradict the messaging.  The cape can never be a jacket, a longcoat, a coat, a robe, or any similar nouns based on its design.  Nor will it ever have a hood.  This garment will attach at the left wrist by a bangle, slide over the arm and across the left shoulder.  It will then dip down the back (under wings for the Aelotoi), under the right arm, and can be pulled across the chest so that it is pinned at the left shoulder with a brooch.
The yierka wool cape will cost 1,500,000 coins.

Thin and flat, the small machine resembles a slightly oversized cigar box with ironwood panels on all sides.  On each of the short, flat sides is a plaque with tiny instructions and square-cut modwir label frames, one displaying "a piece of" and the other stating "contract."  A third frame on one of the longer sides reads "writing" and sits amid wrought iron toggles, dials, switches, buttons, a window, and two glass tubes; both that are empty.  A vertical tube that is empty rests near a glass-paned receptacle that is free of organic debris and ready for use.  The final long side has a pull handle of squared steel that provides access to some sort of drawer, and the lid is decorated with an edge-to-edge infinity knot.
The mechanism can not be worn.
Analysis of a utilitarian grey ironwood mechanism indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The Papermaker was created by the Order of the Lumnasi Viragos on the Isle of Ornath.
The mechanism will create paper if given the proper materials to do so.
Basic Papermaking Instructions
1. Place some kind of foraged bark within the mechanism (each bark makes 4 pages, you can add 25 pieces max)
2. Pour water into the mechanism or cast Minor Water or Holy Bolt at the mechanism (100 doses max)
3. Drop a silver wand in the mechanism to charge it (100 charges max)
4. Drop a candle onto the mechanism to fill the vertical tube with melted wax (100 charges max)
5. Touch the mechanism to create your paper
6. Push the buttons on the mechanism to retrieve your paper
Additional Steps for Advanced Papermaking
~*~ These instructions are for BEFORE using TOUCH
7. Pour Dye into the mechanism to create colored paper (It will consume no more than 5 doses from a vial, but can store 20 doses.)
Tips for Papermaking
1. Look at the mechanism to see everything set on it
2. Glance over the mechanism to see what you will make
The mechanism is tier 1 out of 7.
It has access to the following verbs:  cast (Minor Water), glance (See Design), look, pour (Add Water or Dye), push (Get Created Paper), put (Add Bark or Silver Wand), and touch (Create Paper)
This mechanism can create writing paper.
ANALYZE again in the next 10 seconds for Customization and Alteration Instructions.
The grey ironwood mechanism will cost 2,500,000 coins.

a canary yellow canvas tent

[Brodega's Tent]
The interior of the tent is pretty sparse.  Bits of sand and dirt are scattered across the ground.  The scent of mildew permeates the air.

The deeply cratered surface of this moonstone globe practically calls out to be touched and explored.  When the light hits it just right, it emanates a soft ivory-gold glow that captures the attention.  The sphere rests securely upon its walnut stand.
The globe can not be worn.
Analysis of a pitted moonstone Liabo globe indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Clockwork Globes ~*~

Created in 2001 by GMs Krilcan and Mitra, a pitted moonstone Liabo globe is a clockwork/mechanical globe.  It may be altered, but there are very specific requirements, so please be familiar with them.  It is Tier 2 of 2.
Verb Traps:
* Tier 1: poke, pull, push, and rub
* Tier 2:  fidget, lick, tickle, and turn
Alteration Guidelines:
* Any willing merchant may alter this, but unlocks require special permissions.  Cannot change type.
* In addition to the base 15/15/15, this item may have a long and/or show.  All normal ALTER rules apply.
* Each globe has its own hard-coded SHOW that prepends when you LOOK at the item, so do not contradict it.
* The noun must remain globe, and do not reference the stand in a long.
* There is a small button on the stand, and inner clockwork is mentioned in verb messagings.
* The globe and stand material customizations may have to be done at the same time if the requested service references them in some way.

* Stand Material Custom: the adjective(s) that comes before the word 'stand.'  It must be a type of material able to hold a globe.  It can be preceded by something descriptive as well (ex. pearl-inlaid mahogany).
* Globe Material Custom: the type of material, can have a modifier (ex. silver-sparked lapis).
Specific Requirements by Globe Type:
* Liabo:  White or silver-white material.  It has deep craters
~*~ End Custom Analyze ~*~

~*~ Clockwork Globes ~*~

Created in 2001 by GMs Krilcan and Mitra, a faceted ruby Tilaok globe is a clockwork/mechanical globe.  It may be altered, but there are very specific requirements, so please be familiar with them.  It is Tier 2 of 2.
Verb Traps:
* Tier 1: poke, pull, push, and rub
* Tier 2:  fidget, lick, tickle, and turn
Alteration Guidelines:
* Any willing merchant may alter this, but unlocks require special permissions.  Cannot change type.
* In addition to the base 15/15/15, this item may have a long and/or show.  All normal ALTER rules apply.
* Each globe has its own hard-coded SHOW that prepends when you LOOK at the item, so do not contradict it.
* The noun must remain globe, and do not reference the stand in a long.
* There is a small button on the stand, and inner clockwork is mentioned in verb messagings.
* The globe and stand material customizations may have to be done at the same time if the requested service references them in some way.

* Stand Material Custom: the adjective(s) that comes before the word 'stand.'  It must be a type of material able to hold a globe.  It can be preceded by something descriptive as well (ex. pearl-inlaid mahogany).
* Globe Material Custom: the type of material, can have a modifier (ex. silver-sparked lapis).
Specific Requirements by Globe Type:
* Tilaok:  Red material, carved slightly to reflect a gentle terrain
~*~ End Custom Analyze ~*~

items.name: some grey elesine sandals with twisted indigo suede ties

raw: While the crisscrossing main straps, heel risers, and heel leashes of the sandals are made of lustrous light grey elesine, the soles and footbed are a dull-finished pewter leather.  Woven along the strips of elesine of the upper straps and heel leash are thin cords of indigo suede that extend beyond the base structure of the sandal to serve as ties.  The dye work on the suede is inconsistent, ranging from light blue to dark and back again, like the moonlight-dappled waves of a nighttime sea.
It is estimated that some grey elesine sandals with twisted indigo suede ties can store a very small amount with enough space for one item of very small size.

The elesine from which it is woven has a triaxial pattern accented by the subtle metallic sheen of the sea silk base and thread-thin strands of electrum.  Along the edges of the deep hood and belled sleeves are tendrils of indigo satin, the embroidery sinuous and curved like the lithe body of an eel.  At the throat, a ghezyte chelioboros clasp closes the robe.

items.name: a swath of vibrant blue and green silk

raw: Analysis of a swath of vibrant blue and green silk indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Illegal Alteration Clothing Line (IACLs) ~*~

This item can have different descriptions when held and worn.  Wait!  What??  That's right, you can now have a tight bodice, low-rise pants, or maybe a long cloak that actually drags on the ground.  Keep in mind that normal alteration rules may still apply based on merchant personalities and general good taste.
Verbs:  ATTEND, REMOVE, RUB and WEAR
Alteration Guidelines:
* You can have a base, long, and show
* Base:  the same for both worn and unworn
* Long:  not required for unworn (unless you want a show) but required for worn
* Show:  not required, but if you have it, it will be the same for worn and unworn, and you will need a long for unworn too
* DISALLOWED:  Anything that references exposed skin is not allowed (so no shoulder-baring shirts or tight pants revealing a toned abdomen, for example)
* Overly Risque Items:  This script is not meant to get around any policies on overly risque items.  The merchant has final say on this.
This item has the following worn description:
a swath of vibrant blue and green silk knotted loosely at the waist
The vibrant blue silk will cost 500,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 25,000 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of cloth.
It has a temporarily unlocked loresong by Ouna.

details.flare: the power of an ice elemental

raw: Studying the nugget, you notice it is set to the PIN worn location.
The nugget can not be worn.
Analysis of a faenor nugget indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Your nugget is used to unlock the potential of things held in your other hand or on your person.
A faenor nugget grants the ability to transmute an eligible enhancive armament into a jewelry item.
DETAILS:
> Eligible armaments include armor, weapons, shields, armor accessories, and UCS gloves/boots.
> The armament must be unscripted.  Looted feras items are permitted.
> In most cases, the resulting jewelry item is "a/an/some <material> <noun>."
> Wooden belts will be "a/an <material>-linked belt."
> Enhancive, attunement, and loresong recall properties will transfer.
> The source item will be destroyed.
> Nouns are dictated by the selected worn location for the transmute.
> Use LOOK to view the current setting.
> Use TURN [to #] to toggle to the next or a specific worn location.  Currently: PIN
(1) pin  [pin]           (7)  arms   [armbands]
(2) head [crown]         (8)  wrist  [bracelet]
(3) hair [barrette]      (9)  finger [ring]
(4) ear  [earring]       (10) waist  [belt]
(5) ears [earrings]      (11) ankle  [anklet]
(6) neck [necklace]
You need only RAISE your nugget while holding a compatible item in your other hand or on your person.
Your nugget may not be altered or changed in any way.
The faenor nugget will cost 33,999,900 coins.
